title: How to Check Your Typing Speed Correctly
description: Learn the best methods to check your typing speed online. Understand the difference between gross and net speed, and how to track your improvement.
author: Free Online Typing Team
content:
Why Check Your Typing Speed?

In the digital age, typing is a fundamental skill. Knowing how to check typing speed accurately is crucial for self-improvement. Whether you're a student, developer, or writer, your efficiency at the keyboard directly impacts your productivity.

The Right Way to Check My Typing Speed

Many people ask, "How do I check my typing speed effectively?" It's not just about mashing keys as fast as possible. Here is the correct process:

  1. Choose a Reliable Tool: Use a standardized platform like FreeOnlineTyping.com. Avoid non-standard tests that don't account for errors properly.
  2. Warm Up: Before you test my typing speed for a record, spend 2-3 minutes typing casually to loosen up your fingers.
  3. Simulate Real Conditions: Don't just type random words. Use our 'Quotes' or 'Sentences' mode to mimic real-world typing scenarios.
  4. Take Multiple Tests: A single test can be a fluke. Take at least three tests and calculate the average to get your true speed.

Understanding Your Results

When you use a typing speed checker, you'll see several metrics:

  • Raw WPM: How fast you typed without penalty for errors.
  • Accuracy: The percentage of correct keystrokes. Aim for 95%+.
  • Adjusted/Net Speed: Your raw speed minus a penalty for errors. This is your 'real' speed.

How Often Should You Check?

You don't need to check words per minute every hour. We recommend:

  • Daily: For heavy practice sessions (track practice WPM).
  • Weekly: To measure genuine skill acquisition.
  • Monthly: To update your resume or portfolio benchmarks.
